intro: Iris spuria subsp. spuria, commonly known as the common iris, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to temperate regions of Europe and western Asia. It features upright, sword-shaped leaves and tall, slender stems that bear showy, six-petaled flowers in shades of blue, purple, and white. The plant is characterized by its distinctive spurred petal, which is a unique botanical feature in the iris genus. It typically blooms in late spring to early summer and prefers moist, well-drained soils. Iris spuria subsp. spuria is often found in wet meadows, stream banks, and other damp habitats.
